options.label: B
options.text: By recognizing a power greater than ourselves and a life longer than the ones we will live

options.label: C
options.text: By acknowledging that the only way we're going to survive is for us to figure out how to reach a shared liberation together

title: Why is pneumonia so dangerous? - Eve Gaus and Vanessa Ruiz

multiple-choice.question: What is the function of the alveoli in the lungs?

options.label: A
options.text: To filter out oxygen from the air we breathe.

options.label: B
options.text: To facilitate a crucial exchange of oxygen from the air we breathe into the bloodstream and clearing out carbon dioxide.

options.label: C
options.text: To produce mucus that traps invaders.

options.label: D
options.text: To destroy foreign organisms by enveloping and eating them.

multiple-choice.question: What is the mucociliary escalator?

options.label: A
options.text: A type of white blood cell that defends against foreign organisms.

options.label: B
options.text: A mechanism that traps invaders and carries mucus toward the mouth.

options.label: C
options.text: A process that destroys pathogens by releasing additional white blood cells.

options.label: D
options.text: A system that helps the body breathe more quickly to clear out carbon dioxide.

multiple-choice.question: What is the cause of pneumonia?

options.label: A
options.text: An infection of the alveoli that causes them to fill with fluid.

options.label: B
options.text: A virus or bacteria that enters the body via droplets in the air or contaminated surfaces.

options.label: C
options.text: A genetic disorder that makes someone more susceptible to pathogens.

options.label: D
options.text: A lack of access to healthcare.

multiple-choice.question: What is the effect of pneumonia on the body?

options.label: A
options.text: It makes gas exchange inside the alveoli easier.

options.label: B
options.text: It generates inflammation and fluid as a by-product of the inflammation.

options.label: C
options.text: It destroys foreign organisms by enveloping and eating them.

options.label: D
options.text: It produces mucus that traps invaders.

multiple-choice.question: How can pneumonia be treated?

options.label: A
options.text: With antibiotics that may include either antibacterial or antiviral treatments.

options.label: B
options.text: With a vaccine that protects against common pneumonia-causing pathogens.

options.label: C
options.text: With a healthy diet and regular exercise.

options.label: D
options.text: With a medication that destroys foreign organisms by enveloping and eating them.

multiple-choice.question: What is the risk of pneumonia for someone who smokes?

options.label: A
options.text: It makes them less susceptible to pathogens that can cause pneumonia.

options.label: B
options.text: It makes them more susceptible to pathogens that can cause pneumonia.

options.label: C
options.text: It has no effect on their susceptibility to pathogens.

options.label: D
options.text: It makes them more likely to contract bacterial respiratory infection.

multiple-choice.question: What is the risk of pneumonia for young children and the elderly?

options.label: A
options.text: They have a weaker immune system and impaired clearance.

options.label: B
options.text: They have a stronger immune system and better clearance.

options.label: C
options.text: They have no increased risk of pneumonia.

options.label: D
options.text: They have a lower risk of pneumonia.

multiple-choice.question: What is the cause of death from pneumonia in many cases?

options.label: A
options.text: A lack of access to healthcare.

options.label: B
options.text: A genetic disorder that makes someone more susceptible to pathogens.

options.label: C
options.text: A virus or bacteria that enters the body via droplets in the air or contaminated surfaces.

options.label: D
options.text: A sustained fight against the infection that the body can’t maintain.

options.text: The person making the claim is responsible for proving it, and the other person is responsible for disproving it.

options.label: D
options.text: The person making the claim is not responsible for proving it, and the other person is responsible for proving it.

options.label: B

options.label: C
options.text: He was acquitted of all charges.

options.label: B

options.label: D

options.label: D
options.text: Almond milk takes second place, at more than 70 liters of water per glass.

title: The rise of modern populism - Takis S. Pappas

multiple-choice.question: What is populism?

options.label: A
options.text: A form of government that prioritizes individual and respects the rule of law.

options.label: B
options.text: A political ideology that emphasizes the interests of the common people.

options.label: C
options.text: A form of government that has three essential components.

options.label: D
options.text: A political party that seeks to challenge established institutions.

multiple-choice.question: What is the definition of liberal democracy?

options.label: A
options.text: A type of democracy that has one essential component.

options.label: B
options.text: A type of democracy that has three essential components.

options.label: C
options.text: A type of democracy that prioritizes the interests of the wealthy.

options.label: D
options.text: A type of democracy that seeks to overturn established institutions.

multiple-choice.question: What are the three essential components of liberal democracy?

options.label: A
options.text: The acceptance of society's many factions, the protection of minority rights, and the rule of law.

options.label: B
options.text: The prioritization of individual and social rights, the protection of minority rights, and the rule of law.

options.label: C
options.text: The prioritization of the interests of the common people, the protection of minority rights, and the rule of law.

options.label: D
options.text: The prioritization of the interests of the wealthy, the protection of minority rights, and the rule of law.

multiple-choice.question: What is the impact of modern populist leaders on liberal democracy?

options.label: A
options.text: They often follow through with their promises and improve public trust.

options.label: B
options.text: They often cast their opponents as traitors and undermine the rule of law.

options.label: C
options.text: They often prioritize the interests of the common people and respect institutions.

options.label: D
options.text: They often seek to challenge established institutions and put the needs of the people first.

multiple-choice.question: What is the difference between modern populism and liberal democracy?

options.label: A
options.text: Modern populism prioritizes the interests of the wealthy, while liberal democracy prioritizes the interests of the common people.

options.label: B
options.text: Modern populism seeks to challenge established institutions, while liberal democracy respects the rule of law.

options.label: C
options.text: Modern populism prioritizes individual and social rights, while liberal democracy prioritizes the interests of the common people.

options.label: D
options.text: Modern populism prioritizes the interests of the common people, while liberal democracy prioritizes the interests of the wealthy.

multiple-choice.question: Who is Andreas Papandreou?

options.label: A
options.text: A charismatic leader who identified himself as embodying the "will of the people."

options.label: B
options.text: A politician who sought to challenge established institutions and put the needs of the people first.

options.label: C
options.text: A leader who prioritized the interests of the wealthy and undermined the rule of law.

options.label: D
options.text: A leader who respected institutions and prioritized individual and social rights.

multiple-choice.question: What is the significance of the term "populism"?

options.label: A
options.text: It refers to a type of government that prioritizes the interests of the common people.

options.label: B
options.text: It refers to a type of government that seeks to challenge established institutions.

options.label: C
options.text: It has been used to describe dozens of political movements with counterintuitive and sometimes contradictory goals.

options.label: D
options.text: It has been used to describe a type of democracy that prioritizes individual and social rights.

multiple-choice.question: What is the relationship between populism and liberal democracy?

options.label: A
options.text: Populism is a form of liberal democracy that prioritizes the interests of the common people.

options.label: B
options.text: Populism is a challenge to liberal democracy that seeks to undermine the rule of law.

options.label: C
options.text: Populism is a form of government that has three essential components, similar to liberal democracy.

options.label: D
options.text: Populism is a form of government that prioritizes individual and social rights, similar to liberal democracy.

multiple-choice.question: What is the impact of populism on public trust?

options.label: A
options.text: It often improves public trust in institutions.

options.label: B
options.text: It often undermines public trust in institutions.

options.label: C
options.text: It has no impact on public trust.

options.label: D
options.text: It often improves public trust in politicians.

multiple-choice.question: What is the relationship between populism and the rule of law?

options.label: A
options.text: Populism often prioritizes the rule of law and respects institutions.

options.label: B
options.text: Populism often seeks to challenge the rule of law and undermine institutions.

options.label: C
options.text: Populism has no impact on the rule of law.

options.label: D
options.text: Populism often improves the rule of law.
